direction.raw_text: : EXT. NEW YORK STREET - DUSK Eke walks by the T-shirt Vendor, goes into a subway station. EXT. ANOTHER STREET - DUSK Ike crosses a busy street where a MAN is being arrested.  Ike is passing the upscale "Millennium Hardware Store".  He glances at the window, looks away, stops and looks again.  The window display is made up of an assortment of Maggie's lamps.  Logo "MAG" is on them.  He smiles and walks on. EXT. CENTRAL PARK RESERVOIR - DUSK Ike stares out at water as he walks. EXT. IKE'S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT Ike walks along sidewalk, crosses street, enters his building. INT. IKE'S APARTMENT - NIGHT Ike opens the door to his apartment and flicks on the lights.  He crosses to hang his coat in the closet.  In the closet mirror, he sees and is stunned to find:  MAGGIE, sitting on the couch holding Italics, the cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Ike. He closes the closet and crosses to his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me.  My doorman is one of your many admires... I knew I should have given him a better Christmas gift. Maggie smiles tenuously.  She's more than a little terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been making friends with your cat. (then) Is it okay that I'm here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have much choice in the matter now, do I?  But I can't speak for Italics. (to Cat) Traitor! He moves to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't blame you for being mad... Ike looks at her.  Apparently the word "mad" is an understatement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) ... Or... furious. Ike looks at her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) ... Irate?  Livid?  How's that? He starts putting cat food in a bowl.  The cat leaves Maggie's side and starts to east.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Livid is good.  So what is it, Maggie? You here on business?  I saw your lamps. They're terrific.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's something I've always wanted to do. Ike leaves the kitchen, turns on the balcony lights and re-enters the living room from the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You actually could make breaking and entering into a new career. (after opening the glass doors) So, what are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to talk to you about why I run or ride away from things. Ike moves away from her and sits on the steps near the balcony window, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after sitting) Does it matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so... When I was walking down the aisle?  I was  walking toward somebody who didn't have any idea who I really was.  And it was only half the other person's fault, because I had done everything to convince him that I was exactly what he wanted.  So it was good that I didn't go through with it because it would have been a lie, but you -- you knew the real me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't.  And you being the one at the end of the aisle didn't just fix that. Ike takes this in.  She's reaching him -- but then the defenses go back up.  He turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I couldn't fix anything... (as he gets up) But I still ended up chasing a truck. Ike moves out to the balcony.  After a moment, Maggie follows him. EXT. BALCONY/IKE'SAPARTMENT - NIGHT The balcony overlooks Central Park.  The twinkling lights of the city stretch out across the beautiful night.  Ike looks out at the view with his back to Maggie as she speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand why you bring up the truck. Let me explain something.  The fact is, you've seen me at my worst, most embarrassing, deviously plotting, potentially but not certifiably, psychotic state.  And if you liked me then, I mean, now... I can't imagine... (crosses to him) Benedict. Ike has no response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I love eggs Benedict.  I hate all the other kinds. She hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) ... I hate big weddings with everybody staring.  I would like to get married on a weekday while everybody is at work. If I ride off into the sunset, I want my own horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I be writing this down? She returns to the balcony and hands him the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are for you. He opens it.  It's her running shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're mine.  I'm turning in my running shoes to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is getting serious. Now she is glowing at him, shining with the full force of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And one more thing.  I know it's hard to believe there could be more.  Um... Maggie glances around and spots a DECK CHAIR, which she turns so it is facing the city lights.  Then she softly says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) If you could have a seat, please. Ike sits.  Maggie takes the box from him and puts it aide.  And then she gets down on one knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) Oh my God.  No. Maggie smiles up at him.  Ike tips his head back and covers his eyes with his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no -- don't hide your face, this only happens once in a lifetime.  It's definitely a first to me, and you're not going to want to miss it. He smiles as he looks at Maggie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I love you, Homer Eisenhower Graham. Will you marry me? Ike swallows, overwhelmed, overjoyed, and scared shitless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maggie, I gotta think about this a little bit. Maggie hops cheerfully back to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cheerful) Good. She gets off her knees and stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I was hoping you'd say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughing) You were not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was, because if you said "yes" right away, I wouldn't get to say this next part.  And I've been practicing it. (pulling up a chair and sitting) Ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tenderly) "I guarantee that we'll have tough times.  I guarantee  that at some point one or both oof us will want to get out. But I also guarantee that if I don't ask you to be mine, I'll regret it for the rest of my life. Because I know in my heart -- you're the only one for me". Ike takes her hands affectionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty good speech, Maggie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I borrowed it from this guy I know. So? Ike looks into Maggie's shining face and pauses.  He gets up and motions with his hand for her to stay seated.  He goes inside and turns on some music.  The cat is sitting by the radio.  He returns to the balcony and takes Maggie's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dance with me. They start to dance a slow dance.
direction.name: direction
